nodes.response_message: From which mode you are trying to make calls?

Please prefix “0” when you are dialling any mobile number from a fixed line number (JioFiber Voice) from 15th January 2021 onwards.

Ensure the following:
  1. You must have a dial tone on your landline. If not, try reconnecting the telephone cable from JioFiber HomeGateway.
  2. Your telephone mode needs to be set to tone instead of pulse.


In case the issue still persists, you can connect to a Jio advisor for resolution.

Please prefix “0” when you are dialling any mobile number from a fixed line number (JioFiber Voice) from 15th January 2021 onwards.

Ensure the following:
  1. You must be connected to the JioFiber WiFi.
  2. Status of the JioFiberVoice number in the Settings page needs to be online.
  3. If still not working, try reinstalling JioCall app.


In case the issue still persists, you can connect to a Jio advisor for resolution.

nodes.response_message: Do you see stable green LED on your Home gateway router?
Are you connected to WiFi or LAN?
Please switch OFF the Jio Home Gateway (Router) & wait for 30 seconds. Then, switch the Jio Home Gateway (Router) ON and wait for to restart. It takes around 3 minutes to restart.
Please switch off Wi-Fi on your device & reconnect to JioFiber Wi-Fi. If issues still persist, you can connect our chat advisor.
Please check if the LAN cable is firmly connected at both ends Jio Home Gateway (Router) & Laptop / PC).
Is the issue addressed?

Please connect LAN cable properly and switch OFF the Jio Home Gateway (Router) & wait for 30 seconds. Then, switch the Jio Home Gateway (Router) ON and wait for to restart. It takes around 3 minutes to re-start. Try again once router is restarted.
That’s Great! Enjoy High Speed internet on JioFiber.

nodes.response_message: From which mode you are trying to receive calls?

Ensure the following :
  1. You must have a dial tone on your landline. If not try reconnecting the telephone cable from JioFiber HomeGateway. Your telephone mode needs to be set to tone instead of pulse.
  2. Also, ask the caller to prefix '0' before landline number.


In case the issue still persists, you can connect to a Jio advisor for resolution.

Ensure the following :
  1. You must be connected to the JioFiber WiFi.
  2. Status of the JioFiberVoice number in the settings page needs to be online.
  3. If still not working, try reinstalling JioCall app.


In case the issue still persists, you can connect to a Jio advisor for resolution.
